description: Several eateries are offering grilled lamb and bubur lambuk, a Ramadan staple of spiced porridge.  Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Breaking fast for Ramadan: Halal hotpot, coconut sambal chicken and buffets galore
title_page: Breaking fast for Ramadan: Halal hotpot, coconut sambal chicken and buffets galore | The Straits Times
maintext:
SINGAPORE – Besides the bustling bazaars in Geylang Serai and Kampong Gelam, halal-certified eateries and hotel buffets are offering a wide spread of delights to break fast in the holy month of Ramadan.
Ramadan starts on March 12 and ends on April 9. Hari Raya Puasa falls on April 10.
